clinical_study.brief_title: Dietary Sodium Restriction in Hemodialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Dietary Sodium Restriction in Hemodialysis Patients: Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

brief_summary.textblock: Excess dietary sodium can lead to poor outcomes, such as hypertension, edema and increased risk for cardiovascular diseases. These complications are associated with end stage renal disease (ESRD) progression and mortality in renal patients. This study aims to evaluate the effects of nutritional counseling restricting dietary sodium and its relation to clinical and diet factors, nutritional knowledge and quality of life in hemodialysis patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Sodium intake will be evaluated by food record and a food frequency questionnaire.
Quality of life will be evaluated by the Brazilian Portuguese version of the Kidney Disease and Quality-of-Life Short-Form (KDQOL-SF) questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.description: Will be considered the amount of weight gain between 2 dialysis sessions.

arm_group.description: Nutritional education on sodium restriction diet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical stable patients on dialysis for at least 3 months, over 18 years old, of both sexes, who agree to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with low cognitive ability, psychiatric disorders, with acute or infectious disease.
